title:
Quasi-stationary distributions for continuous-time $\lambda$-recurrent
  jump processes
abstract:
For the continuous-time $\lambda$-recurrent jump process, the
$\lambda$-recurrence assures the existence of quasi-stationary distribution
when it has finite exit states (the states that have positive killing rates).
And we give an explicit representation for this quasi-stationary distribution
through $Q$-matrix, where the components of the quasi-stationary distribution
outside the set $H$ of exit states can be represented by those within $H$.
Sufficient condition is also provided for quasi-stationary distribution when
the exit states are infinite.
